channel.title: What do you think of my new logo?
channel.description:
I updated my profile pic with my new logo, but if you cant see it, Here-- ![XLXK|452x425](upload://o1cyW1yPio4TmkjQ23uP6N1uCfd.png)
Thats my new logo, i decided to make it sort of like roman numerals, i also put in some effort to make a album cover ![XLXK%20Art|452x425](upload://mwG9vexK0hMSlMGDw58MqoZ80yh.png)
Tell me what you think, i'm open to new suggestions.

item.title: What do you think of my new logo?
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
@akabillposters @blakkaz Ahh makes more sense. And I do somewhat agree. It’s kinda a cheap way to change stuff. But I still believe my point stands that the logo would look better if those things were added.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
That’s correct.

I think there are very few instances where reaching for a Photoshop filter will improve a logo.

item.title: What do you think of my new logo?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
El1011:

why would you want to have your art looking unprofessional.

I think @blakkaz is saying that it’s not a good thing.

i.e. “…the clearest indicator a logo wasn’t designed by a professional.”… and that’s a bad thing.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think of my new logo?

item.title: What do you think of my new logo?
item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
Just wondering, why would you want to have your art looking unprofessional. I get it for certain circumstances and occasional tracks, but I don’t see why it should be your standard logo.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think of my new logo?

item.title: What do you think of my new logo?
item.dc:creator: akabillposters
item.description:
blakkaz:

I think stock FX (shadows, glows, etc…) are the clearest indicator a logo wasn’t designed by a professional.

As a design professional, I can say that it’s not that black and white.

Shadows, glows, etc… are not innately unprofessional or signs of bad design choices. It’s down to how they’re used. Sure, sometimes, less is more. But similarly, brash, unsubtle effects are sometimes appropriate for the desired aesthetic (e.g. Punk art).

Depends what you’re going for.

If the outcome doesn’t match the intent, then that’s poor design (or poor briefing from the client).

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think of my new logo?

item.title: What do you think of my new logo?
item.dc:creator: blakkaz
item.description:
El1011:

Just a side note, I always (when I have access to photoshop) add a drop shadow and outer glow (tweak the levels of everything as needed) but it makes things pop off the screen more.

As a counterpoint - I think stock FX (shadows, glows, etc…) are the clearest indicator a logo wasn’t designed by a professional.

Keep it simple, stupid.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think of my new logo?

item.title: What do you think of my new logo?
item.dc:creator: XLXK
item.description:
From a distance, this looks to be no problem, but I do see your perspective. I’d have to completely redo the logo in order to get rid of the shadow drop because I don’t have a save file of that version. Thanks for the tips , I’ll try this later

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think of my new logo?

item.title: What do you think of my new logo?
item.dc:creator: Matik
item.description:
It looks too fuzzy with all that blur and drop shadow effects. I suggest possibly using a thicker and bolder font, or even lowering the opacity on the drop shadow, or possibly even adding a slight black to dark grey gradient filter on the text to not make it look completely plain and black.
Those are just my suggestions though.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think of my new logo?

item.title: What do you think of my new logo?
item.dc:creator: XLXK
item.description:
Ok, I might later add a outer glow to the letters, I’m going to have to recreate it though because I didn’t save the part where I added the effect

item.dc:creator: El1011
item.description:
Np. Just a side note, I always (when I have access to photoshop) add a drop shadow and outer glow (tweak the levels of everything as needed) but it makes things pop off the screen more.

Ex: (art for a remix im working on)

(I was gonna upload the actual pic for quality, but the wifi just died & the pic is on my comp not phone. So I didn’t wanna use a whole lot of data lol)

[But u can see the glow& shadow so that’s what matters here lol]
